summary: This document is an email chain forwarding six Touhy requests for information relating to Epstein victims from attorney Brad Edwards to recipients at the Department of Justice. The requests include victim names, and the correspondence seeks approval to respond.

persons.name: Brad Edwards
persons.context: Attorney from Edwards Pottinger LLC who submitted six Touhy requests for information relating to Epstein victims to the Department of Justice.

persons.name: Steven
persons.context: Individual forwarding the attached Touhy requests from Brad Edwards to recipients, asking if they can respond to the requests.

persons.name: Maria Kelljchian
persons.context: Florida Registered Paralegal at Edwards Pottinger LLC who forwarded the Touhy requests from Brad Edwards.

persons.name: Brittany Henderson
persons.context: Attorney at Edwards Pottinger LLC copied on the email containing the Touhy requests.

connections.description: Both work at Edwards Pottinger LLC; Maria forwarded Brad's Touhy requests.
Both are attorneys at Edwards Pottinger LLC; Brittany was copied on the email with the Touhy requests.
Steven forwarded Brad Edwards' Touhy requests to the Department of Justice for response consideration.

events.title: Submission of Touhy Requests
events.description: Attorney Brad Edwards submitted six Touhy requests to the Department of Justice for information relating to Epstein victims.

locations: 425 North Andrews Avenue, Suite 2, Fort Lauderdale, Florida 33301
keyFacts: Six Touhy requests for information relating to Epstein victims were submitted by attorney Brad Edwards to the Department of Justice.
The requests included the names of Epstein victims, though these names are not listed in the provided text.
The correspondence seeks internal approval within the Department of Justice to respond to these information requests.
The document demonstrates ongoing legal efforts by victims' attorneys to obtain information from the government in 2020.
